metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6920 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the decode_block function in libavcodec/exr.cin FFmpeg before 3.1.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(application crash) via vectors involving tile positions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6920` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.1.3-1
libav-tools - 7:3.1.3-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.1.3-1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.1.3-1
libavcodec57 - 7:3.1.3-1
libavdevice57 - 7:3.1.3-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.1.3-1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.1.3-1
libavfilter6 - 7:3.1.3-1
libavformat57 - 7:3.1.3-1
libavresample3 - 7:3.1.3-1
libavutil55 - 7:3.1.3-1
libpostproc54 - 7:3.1.3-1
libswresample2 - 7:3.1.3-1
libswscale4 - 7:3.1.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.1.3-1').
